perturbation.original_text: Grantee shall not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other basis prohibited by state law relating to discrimination in employment, except where there is a bona fide occupational qualification reasonably necessary to the normal operation of the Grantee.
perturbation.changed_text: Grantee shall consider various diversity factors in hiring, but these factors will not be the sole determinate factor in hiring practices. Grantee shall not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, national origin if those factors are not relevant, except where there is a bona fide occupational qualification reasonably necessary to the normal operation of the Grantee.
perturbation.explanation: The original text prohibits discrimination based on various factors. The modified text introduces ambiguity by stating that diversity factors will be considered, then suggests that race, religion, color, sex, and national origin will not be considered sole determinant if irrelevant, making the non-discrimination clause unclear and potentially unenforceable. This violates federal and state laws that strictly prohibit discrimination in employment.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, Virginia Human Rights Act

perturbation.original_text:
All notices required under this Agreement or the Ordinance shall be in writing and shall be deemed validly given, unless otherwise required, when sent by certified mail, return receipt requested, or by a nationally recognized overnight courier, addressed as follows (or any other address the party to be notified may have designated to the sender by like notice):
Grantor: Grantee:
Town of Vinton Roanoke Gas Company
Attention: Town Manager Attention: President
311 S. Pollard Street 519 Kimball Avenue, N.E.
Vinton, Virginia 24179 P.O. Box 13007
Roanoke, Virginia 24030
perturbation.changed_text: All notices provided between the parties are preferred to be in digital format. Grantor and Grantee's contact information may be found on their website. In the event the website information is unavailable, please contact a customer service representative.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause specifies the method to send all notices required and to where. The changed text removes that specificity and changes the method of notice. In doing so, the mandatory language has been removed making it unclear if and when notice was validly provided. This undermines the intention of the notice clause.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles regarding proper notification
